SKOOKii is Venmo for K-12 Schools, After-school programs, Nonprofit organizations and Parents that provides the only frictionless way (no cost, no contracts, no data uploads) to make and collect payments in less than 20 minutes. #SaaS #Payments #Edtech #Fintech --- http://skookii.com/blogOUR MISSION: To be the fastest app for parents and schools to connect and transact all around the world.OUR VISION:To be the trusted go-to payment platform for the global K-12 ecosystem.
Introduced the first and only Paybox payment ATMs to U.S. K-12 schools to streamline accounts receivables at the front office.
DUTIES: Setting Strategy / Building Culture / Making Things Happen & Getting Results

Leading robust internal processes, teams and infrastructure to drive dynamic organizational growth in both scale and complexity to fulfill its academic and community mission. Drive operational excellence across all departments; identifying gaps and implementing process improvements to support efficient and effective back-office operations.Manage and Monitor: District-wide Procurement, Benefits, Student Transportation, and the NSLP Program.

-Administer the internal purchasing system.-Review and approve purchase orders for accuracy, optimum delivery and pricing.-Develop and implement purchasing and contract management instructions, policies, and procedures.-Negotiating and supervising supply contracts and formulating policies with suppliers.-Responsible for the administration,compliance oversight and implementation of the district's benefits program-Respond and assist with annual audits

As Business Manager, supervised the overall business operations of the school, developed and implemented school business policies, and carried out the directives of the superintendent and the board:* Payroll Processing / Budget Management / Cash Management / Accounting / Financial Reporting / Annual Audit / Inventory Management / Risk Management / Property Management / Employee Contracts & Benefits Administration / Marketing & Enrollment / Vendor & Banking Relations,etc.As Dean of Students, was responsible for creating and maintaining a strong, positive school culture that held all students accountable for meeting school's high behavior expectations:* Oversaw a uniform discipline system and monitored consistent and fair administration and tracking of student conduct and discipline data* Contributed toward a safe environment for learning, including ensuring that studentconduct is maintained and discipline is enforced fairly and consistently* Served as liaison to parents and facilitate parent education and involvement,including reinforcing the need for parents to support the school’s policies andpractices for student discipline, dress code, homework, and events* Facilitated faculty and staff development related to school culture and consistent enforcement of student discipline* Organized school events including open houses and undertook administrative and instructional duties as assigned

recommendations: Manuel Perez
CEO / COO / CTO | Technology Company Leadership | Product Vision & Innovation | Performance | Cultural Transformations
May 10, 2016, Manuel was Alisher "Ali"’s mentor

I acted as a mentor for Alisher as part of his company’s incubation period at LearnLaunch. From the moment I met Alisher I could tell that there was something special about him. He has that essential rare combination of vision and ability to execute that is required by any serious entrepreneurial endeavor. While he always listened and was open to new and future ideas, he continuously weighed these and prioritized them in order to launch his minimum viable product, striking an excellent balance between strategic and tactical initiatives. I would recommend Alisher for a business leadership or product management position.

Product Design, Professional Development, Teacher Preparation for K-12 Education
May 3, 2016, David worked with Alisher "Ali" but at different companies

Passion, empathy, kindness. These terms fit Ali perfectly. Ali and I were co-founders of our respective companies that participated in the LearnLaunch educational technology accelerator program from September 2015 to May 2016. Ali was an ideal colleague and fellow entrepreneur. In addition to the personal traits I laid out above, Ali shows the qualities you would  want in a business leader: industry knowledge, unrelenting resourcefulness, and a true connection with parents of school-aged children, for whom Ali and Skookii intend to give back lost time and wasted money. I enjoyed working with Ali, and I learned a great deal from him about my own business.

I strongly recommend Alisher Rakhimov. I worked with Ali during his time at the LearnLaunch Accelerator program. While working on his startup, Skookii, Ali was the epitome of the type of entreprenuer you want to work with. He was diligent, thoughtful, passionate, and innovative. Most importantly he is a great learner and someone who is constantly asking questions. Ali also has a tremendous work ethic...he works tirelessly, but always has as smile on his face and is willing to help other entrepreneurs out. In short, if I was an investor, I would put my money on Alisher. He knows how to get things done and he is a good person to boot.
